alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 9:26PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following county, Lancaster. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported full ditches and 3 to 4 inches of water over some roadways near Malcolm. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Waverly, Malcolm, Raymond, Davey, Lincoln Airport, Holmes Lake Park, Walton and Branched Oak State Recreation Area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
